trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Greenhouse | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Greenhouse | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Greenhouse with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Greenhouse with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Greenhouse.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Greenhouse.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A Greenhouse single sign-on subscription
trans-unit.target: A Greenhouse single sign-on subscription

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Greenhouse will be able to single sign into the application at your Greenhouse company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Greenhouse will be able to single sign into the application at your Greenhouse company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for Greenhouse
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for Greenhouse

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Greenhouse.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Greenhouse.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type greenhouse.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type greenhouse.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select Greenhouse, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select Greenhouse, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Greenhouse</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Greenhouse</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Greenhouse with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Greenhouse with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the Greenhouse application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the Greenhouse application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to Greenhouse page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to Greenhouse page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App URL page, in the Sign On URL textbox, type your URL using the following pattern "https://company.greenhouse.io", and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App URL page, in the Sign On URL textbox, type your URL using the following pattern "https://company.greenhouse.io", and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at Greenhouse page, click Download metadata, and then save metadata file locally on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at Greenhouse page, click Download metadata, and then save metadata file locally on your computer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Forward that Metadata file to Greenhouse Support team.
trans-unit.target: Forward that Metadata file to Greenhouse Support team.

trans-unit.source: Single sign-on has to be enabled by the Greenhouse support team.
trans-unit.target: Single sign-on has to be enabled by the Greenhouse support team.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Greenhouse, they must be provisioned into Greenhouse.
trans-unit.target: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Greenhouse, they must be provisioned into Greenhouse.

trans-unit.source: In the case of Greenhouse, provisioning is a manual task.
trans-unit.target: In the case of Greenhouse, provisioning is a manual task.

trans-unit.source: Log in to your Greenhouse company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: Log in to your Greenhouse company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: In the menu on the top, click Configure, and then click Users.
trans-unit.target: In the menu on the top, click Configure, and then click Users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click New Users.
trans-unit.target: Click New Users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New User</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New User</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Add New User section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the Add New User section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add New User</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add New User</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Enter user emails textbox, type the email address of a valid Azure Active Directory account you want to provision.
trans-unit.target: In the Enter user emails textbox, type the email address of a valid Azure Active Directory account you want to provision.

trans-unit.source: Click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Save.

trans-unit.source: The Azure Active Directory account holders will receive an email including a link to confirm the account before it becomes active.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Active Directory account holders will receive an email including a link to confirm the account before it becomes active.

trans-unit.source: You can use any other Greenhouse user account creation tools or APIs provided by Greenhouse to provision AAD user accounts.
trans-unit.target: You can use any other Greenhouse user account creation tools or APIs provided by Greenhouse to provision AAD user accounts.

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the Greenhouse **application integration page, click **Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the Greenhouse **application integration page, click **Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
